description: The smiling statue of the god Vishnu will undergo a thorough analysis, as well as a slight facelift, by researchers between its May departure from Cambodia and the opening of Paris' Guimet Museum of Asian Arts' exhibition on Khmer bronzes on April 30, 2025.
title: Cambodia's 'Mona Lisa,' a large bronze statue of Vishnu, is due to be examined in Paris

description: An archaeometallurgical study of the royal palace of Angkor's foundry, dating back to the 11th century, began in 2016 as part of a Franco-Cambodian research project. Little by little, the site has revealed the secrets of the bronzesmiths' craft. Archaeologists have also traced the metal back to ancient copper mines.
title: Inside the foundry of Angkor's kings
